citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review at time of this inspection. There were no inventory
records kept since August 7, 2024. A total of 170 adult guinea pigs and 8 offspring were counted during this inspection.
Failure to maintain records can make it difficult to assess the health of the caviary by identifying animal losses by
decreased number of guinea pigs born and raised. Licensee must maintain records containing the required information for
animals which disclose the number of guinea pigs, owned, acquired, or disposed of including births and deaths.

Housekeeping. There were accumulations of cobwebs, dust, dirt, hay, and bedding in empty enclosures and on and
between guinea pig racks. Accumulations of cobwebs, dust, dirt, and old bedding can expose the animals to disease
hazard, health problems, and poor air quality. Correct by ensuring the premises are kept clean, including: removing
accumulations of cobwebs, dust, hay and bedding from empty enclosures, racks, and surfaces; routinely dusting off and
sanitizing all surfaces inside the animal room; and maintaining a general cleanliness to support good animal husbandry
and health. Correct by: October 26, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review at time of this inspection. There were no inventory 
records kept since August 7, 2024. A total of 170 adult guinea pigs and 8 offspring were counted during this inspection. 
Failure to maintain records can make it difficult to assess the health of the caviary by identifying animal losses by 
decreased number of guinea pigs born and raised. Licensee must maintain records containing the required information for 
animals which disclose the number of guinea pigs, owned, acquired, or disposed of including births and deaths. 
3.31(b) 
   
Sanitation. 
Housekeeping. There were accumulations of cobwebs, dust, dirt, hay, and bedding in empty enclosures and on and 
between guinea pig racks. Accumulations of cobwebs, dust, dirt, and old bedding can expose the animals to disease 
hazard, health problems, and poor air quality. Correct by ensuring the premises are kept clean, including: removing 
accumulations of cobwebs, dust, hay and bedding from empty enclosures, racks, and surfaces; routinely dusting off and 
sanitizing all surfaces inside the animal room; and maintaining a general cleanliness to support good animal husbandry 
and health. Correct by: October 26, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
